department: Ministère des Travaux publics et des Services gouvernementaux (SPAC)
short_summary: Procurement to acquire deuterated organochlorine pesticides standards (OCP)
description: All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted at the latest by 2 PM EST on February 8, 2023. All bids submitted after 2 PM EST will result in the bid being declared non-responsive. PWGSC, on behalf of Environment and Climate Change Canada is issuing this request for proposal for the acquisition of deuterated organochlorine pesticides standards (OCP) located in Montreal, Québec, Canada, as detailed in Annex A.
full_summary:
# K8C13-230630-Purchasing chemicals
## [Request for Proposal]
### *Indicators and Reagents (12161500)*

#### Issue Date: 2023-01-23 | Submission Deadline: 2023-02-08 2:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST)

This title should be a concise and spelled-out version of the title.
#### Request for Proposal Announcement

Department of Public Works and Government Services on behalf of the Department of the Environment is soliciting proposals for the acquisition of deuterated organochlorine pesticides standards. The procurement is part of an effort to supply Environment and Climate Change Canada with essential chemicals located in Montreal, Québec, Canada.

#### Procurement Details
- **UNSPSC Code**: 12161500 - Indicators and Reagents
- **Trade Agreement**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- **Regulatory Requirements**: This procurement is governed by the applicable laws and regulations of the Government of Canada.

#### Who Should Attend
This request for proposal is intended for businesses wishing to provide the essential chemicals. If you believe your company meets the requirements outlined in the contract, you can submit a bid.

#### Additional Documents

All supporting documents and bid submissions must be received by 2:00 PM EST on February 8, 2023. Failure to submit bids before the deadline will result in the bids being declared non-compliant.

#### Contact Information
For any additional information or questions, please contact Annie Blanchet, Senior Contracting Authority. You can reach her via the following contact details:

* Email: annie.blanchet@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

#### Procurement Method
The procurement method employed for this purchase is competitive. Interested parties must submit their bids according to the specifications outlined in the contract.

#### Regions Of Supply
The region of supply for this procurement is the Province of Quebec, specifically Montreal, Québec, Canada.

Visit our website [http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15204938?extsite=MTUyMDQ5MzhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15204938?extsite=MTUyMDQ5MzhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==) to obtain additional information and documentations necessary for a successful bid.  | This link directs you to the official website for obtaining bidder documentation.
